III. INVESTIGATION
2

Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications.
Section (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has ongoing contact
Description with children or parents to be a person who has the ability,
experience, education, and training to perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation.
Type
Allegation The case worker has been making unethical comments about the
birth mother. The worker has been joking and laughing at the birth
mother and saying that it is funny that the birth mother is getting
upset with her.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant X
On 5/2/2023 I interviewed Complainant X by telephone.
Complainant X reported being a support person to Birth Parent B.
Complainant X said the allegations are true because the birth
mother, Birth Parent B reported this negative behavior by Foster
Care Worker (FCW) 2 to her at least seven times since Child A
entered care. Complainant X said Birth Parent B contacted
Complainant X every time Birth Parent B has been with FCW 2 and
gotten upset. Birth Parent B told Complainant X that FCW 2
bragged about birth parents getting upset with her all the time. And
that FCW 2 thinks that is funny. Complainant X reported Birth Parent
B told her that on one occasion FCW 2 broke confidentially by
mentioning a client’s first name. Birth Parent B reported during the
conversation FCW 2 stated “R” had gotten upset with her, “kind of
like you,” Birth Parent B. Birth Parent B also reported that FCW 2
has watched her at her home. Further FCW 2 has commented to
Birth Parent B that Birth Parent B better not be going to do anything
else, when FCW 2 observed Birth Parent B go to smoke a cigarette
(Complainant X did not elaborate on what anything else meant.). The
interactions by FCW 2 have taken place at Birth Parent B’s home.
Complainant X reported Birth Parent B is fighting hard to get her son
back and FCW 2 seems to be trying to work against Birth Parent B.
Complainant X admitted she has never met FCW 2 or witnessed the
unethical behaviors FCW 2 was alleged to have displayed with Birth
Parent B. Nor has Complainant X ever spoken with FCW 2, or heard
FCW 2 joking, laughing or making fun of Birth Parent B.
Complainant X reported Birth Parent B’s brother, Person C, ex-
mother in-law Person D and Child A's birth father, Person E have
been present when FCW 2 has behaved with Birth Parent B in the
negative manner as described in this complaint. Complainant X
reported the only person she has spoken to about her concerns with
FCW 2 is Chief Administrator 1, whom she thought was FCW 2’s
supervisor. Chief Administrator 1 told her other birth parents have
3

complained about FCW 2. Chief Administrator 1 did not report what
those complaints were about. Chief Administrator 1 reported not
being sure what she could do legally about FCW 2’s behaviors, but
Chief Administrator 1 will contact upper administration about the
matter.
Chief Administrator 1
On 5/4/2023 I spoke with Chief Administrator 1 by telephone about
the allegations. Chief Administrator 1 reported speaking with a
person who identified herself as a friend and support person to Birth
Parent B; and with Birth Parent B about allegations of FCW 2
speaking and behaving unprofessionally with Birth Parent B. Chief
Administrator 1 denied telling either of those individuals that there
was nothing she could do legally about the allegations.
Chief Administrator 1 reported advising the friend/support person to
Birth Parent B that Chief Administrator 1 was not sure that a support
person has legal standing to file a grievance with the agency on the
case. This is usually done by the birth parent, but she will follow up
on the matter. Chief Administrator also advised Birth Parent B she
would review the matter; and that she had spoken with the support
person/friend. She asked Birth Parent B, what Birth Parent B wanted
to come from this complaint. Birth Parent B reported wanting another
worker, which Chief Administrator 1 advised she had to review
everything about this situation. She also offered to meet with Birth
Parent B. She advised me that Child A’s case is one that permanent
custody is pending on; so there may likely be concern coming from
the birth parent due to that.
Chief Administrator 1 denied being aware of any other complaints by
birth parents pertaining to FCW 2
Birth Parent B
On 5/12/2023 I interviewed Birth Parent B by telephone. Birth Parent
B reported the allegations are true. I asked Birth Parent B to report
what part of the allegations were true. Birth Parent B reported that
three months ago, FCW 2 started acting differently toward her. FCW
2 started making little negative comments. Birth Parent B was
unable to give me the specific negative comments FCW 2 made
against her. She reported that after the last court date and FCW 2
filing a petition for permanent custody related to Child A, FCW 2 has
made several negative comments and FW2 appeared to have been
watching her.
Birth Parent B advised that during a parent/child visitation at her
home, FCW 2 mentioned something about another birth parent being
4

upset with her. Reportedly the birth parent called FCW 2 a “Bitch and
said she hoped FCW 2 gets hit by a car. FCW 2 said the birth
parent’s first name, that “R” or “RA” “was mad at her, sort of like you”
referring to Birth Mother B. FCW 2 did not make another negative
statement about Birth Parent B during this conversation. Birth
Parent B reported that sometime later, when a mental health team
person dropped off medication for her, she made the statement, “I’m
not even mad at FCW 2, I am just upset she thinks I am a bad mom.”
She said FCW 2 responded to her by saying “Yeah that’s right”
without even looking up at her. Birth Parent B brought these
statements up in her attempt to explain to me how FCW 2 makes
negative/unprofessional remarks about her. Birth Parent B reported
believing FCW 2 is being unfair to her by FCW 2 constantly bringing
up a negative drug screen for her at court, etc. Birth Parent B
reported this makes “me look really bad”; especially since that was a
long time ago.
Birth Parent B reported her home is across the street/in eyesight of
the agency’s office. Agency staff can see her; and they watch her
house. FCW 2 has sent her text messages saying stuff like I see
you leaving, where are you going. Birth Parent B stated, “It’s like
she’s stalking me”. She said FCW 2 did this five or six times. Birth
Parent B reported this matter to Foster Care Supervisor 3 three
months ago. FSC 3 had Birth Parent B to forward the text
message(s) to FCS 3. Birth Parent B was not sure she still had any
of the text messages. She was going to check her phone and if so,
she would provide them to me. She was not sure what if anything
was done by FCS. She denied a meeting with Chief Administrator 1
about this complaint, but she spoke with Chief Administrator 1. Chief
Administrator 1 telephoned her on 5/2/2023/ the day of the
complaint. Chief Administrator 1 thanked her for the information and
reported she would conduct an investigation and get back to her.
Birth Parent B denied Person D or Person E ever being present to
hear or witnessing FCW 2 making inappropriate comments to her or
being unprofessional as alleged by this complainant. The only
person to have witnessed negative behavior by FCW 2 was her
brother, Person C. Person C and Person C’s girlfriend were visiting
the home while a parent/child had occurred.
It is worth stating, that no text message or messages were ever
received from Birth Parent B.
Person C
On 5/12/2023, I interviewed Person C by telephone. Person C
affirmed being Birth Parent B’s brother and being present at a
5

parent/child visit at Birth Parent B’s home. He affirmed some aspect
of what Birth Parent B reporting related to another parent being
mentioned. He said FCW 2 had called early one day in the AM to
report she would be late because of another parent/child visit she
was dealing with. When FCW 2 arrived at Birth Parent B’s home
FCW 2 said she was late because “R”, (a name Person C said
probably should not have been used) was upset with her and hoped
she was hit by a car. FCW laughed when she made that statement.
Person C did not report FCW 2 telling Birth Parent B she was upset
like that parent. He recalled Birth Parent B asking FCW 2 why FCW
2 kept bringing up to the judge that Birth Parent B had had a positive
drug test when that was in the past; and no longer mattered.
Person C said he did not know whether FCW 2 called Birth Parent B
stupid, what the word stupid was used when FCW 2 said “that’s for
the judge to decide” if it matters. Person C said Birth Parent B
became upset after that and there was not must communication
between Birth Parent B and FCW 2 thereafter. Person C denied
directly hearing FCW 2 to laugh at Birth Parent B, call Birth Parent B
stupid or any other negative name, or to yell at her.
Foster Care Worker (FCW)2
I interviewed FCW 2 by telephone on 5/16/2023. FCW 2 reported
being the case worker on Birth Parent B’s case for a little over one
year. She denied the allegations in this complaint; or that any other
birth parents had made complaints about her. She reported never
acting inappropriate with Birth Parent B or any client. She said she
would never call Birth Parent B a derogatory name. She advised that
since Child A’s goal was change to adoption at a hearing on
4/14/2023, Birth Parent B has been getting upset with her. FCW 2
reports it is Birth Parent B who has make comments to her, such as
wishing FCW 2 does not make it back from a vacation. FCW 2
reported she has told her clients that other clients have been upset
with her also, and that’s okay. She has also explained that other
clients have threatened bodily harm to her. She reported encourages
all the birth parents she works with to express their feelings, so they
can work things through. She denied ever using one client’s name
when talking with another. She admitted to having a client name
“R”, but denied reporting the name to Birth Parent B. She advised
that “R” was blowing up her phone one day and Birth Parent B may
have somehow, inadvertently seen the name.
FCW 2 admitted there was a time, during a home visit, whereby Birth
Parent B made a comment about it being stupid that FCW 2 must
keep talking about drug screens. FCW 2 said during that time, she
told Birth Parent B it was not stupid; it was her wanting to Birth
Parent B and Child A to be safe. Also, that it was the judge who
6

makes the decision about Child A’s permanent custody/Birth Parent
B’s rights being termination.
FCW 2 affirmed Birth Parent B’s reporting about where Birth Parent
B’s home is located in proximity to the Bethany office. They have
joked that Birth Parent B can see her office; but FCW 2 denied ever
tracking Birth Parent B. FCW 2 admitted that there was a couple of
times she has driven by Birth Parent B’s home and saw Birth Parent
B and commented to her via a text message. FCW 2 said once she
observed Birth Parent B sitting outside with a group of people and
she texted Birth Parent B something like that’s awesome. She
reported making that comment as an encouragement, because Birth
Parent B is usually by herself; and Birth Parent B being along is a
trigger for her mental health. She also text Birth Parent B once when
she saw her outside in the cold, but the text messages have not
been negative.
Foster Care Supervisor (FCS) 3
On 5/17/2023 I interviewed FCS 3 by telephone. FCS 3 denied there
being complaints made by other birth parents against FCW 2 about
FCW 2’s behavior. FCS 3 denied ever observing FCW 2 to behave
inappropriate or unprofessional in her actions with families. FCW 2
is friendly with all the clients; and that helps FCW 2 built a rapport.
FCS # reported Birth Parent B is one who struggles with her own
mental health and Birth Parent B has made inappropriate statement,
inclusive of one of hurting herself.
FCS 3 also advised Birth Parent B’s home is situated in proximity of
the agency, whereby they must turn by Birth Parent B’s home to get
to their office. She admitted that several months ago, around
Christmas, Birth Parent B spoke with her about a concern Birth
Parent B had related to a text message received from FCW 2 about
Birth Parent B being outside. The text message said something to
the effect of “I see you outside”. Birth Parent B reported wanting to
feel safe in her home and to get a text message like that didn’t make
her feel safe. FCS 3 explained to Birth Parent B that they do not do
surveillance on their clients, and she would speak with FCW 2 about
the matter. In speaking with FCW 2, FCW 2 reported the text
occurred during office work hours. FCW 2 said as she was driving
by the home, she saw Birth Parent B sitting outside; and as it was
really cold outside, she texted Birth Parent B something about
maybe going inside. FCS 3 sent me that text message. She
reported a couple of weeks after her interaction with Birth Parent B
on that matter, Birth Parent B was in the office and Birth Parent B
told Chief Administrator 1 it was great working with FCW 2.
7

Document Review
The MISACWIS case record for Birth Parent B’ case which showed:
• Birth Parent B is the birth mother to Child A, a 1 ½ year old
male.
• Child A is a temporary court ward, whose case has been
under Bethany Christian Services’ supervision since 4/5/2022.
A text message dated 1/2/2023, for 2:25PM report from FCW 2 to
Birth Parent B. The text message read as follows:
• “Get back inside. It’s cold ya crazies”
• Birth Parent B responded back with a smiley face and “Yeah it
is!!
Analysis Based on interviews/information obtained related to this special
investigation, there is insufficient evidence to showed that the worker
negatively joked about, laughed at or behaved in a derogatory or
unethical manner with Birth Parent B. Nor that FCW 2 or agency
staff did not have the ability, experience, education, and training to
perform the duties assigned.
Technical assistance
The agency is advised to caution staff around wording in texts
message to birth parents. The wording “ya crazies” though it may
not be belligerent or viewed as inappropriate when communicating
with a friend or relative; it may not be received well by a client.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
